description: Including properties in the RDF from JSONs may become tricky when the JSON are not plain or flat. In order to access nested levels of the JSON the operator '.' can be used. On the other hand, for nested arrays regular directives for arrays can be used. For the sample JSON {"k1" : 33, "k2" : { "k3" : 44  }} stored in a var "var" to access the value of k1 the mapping should specify "var.k1", instead to access k3 the mapping should specify "var.k2.k3". Complete the mapping below for generating triplets containing the names and the surfaces as shown in the results section.
solution_template:
<#assign locations=providers("HttpProvider", { "method" : "GET", "url" : "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/helio-ecosystem/helio-ecosystem/main/resources/mappings-data/ldac/nested_locations1.json"})>
<#assign locations = locations?eval>
<#list locations as location>
<http://sample.com/resource/[=location.name]> a <http://schema.org/Place>;
    <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/name> "[=location.name]" ;
    <http://vocab.es/schema#surface> "[=location.features.surface.value] [=location.features.surface.units]" .
</#list>
expected_result:
<http://sample.com/resource/Oneonta> a <http://schema.org/Place>;
    <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/name> "Oneonta" ;
    <http://vocab.es/schema#surface> "90.16 Km2" .
<http://sample.com/resource/Iowa> a <http://schema.org/Place>;
    <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/name> "Iowa" ;
    <http://vocab.es/schema#surface> "167.2 Km2" .
<http://sample.com/resource/Alberta> a <http://schema.org/Place>;
    <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/name> "Alberta" ;
    <http://vocab.es/schema#surface> "33.75 Km2" .
<http://sample.com/resource/Bock> a <http://schema.org/Place>;
    <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/name> "Bock" ;
    <http://vocab.es/schema#surface> "73.74 Km2" .
<http://sample.com/resource/Elmhurst> a <http://schema.org/Place>;
    <http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/name> "Elmhurst" ;
    <http://vocab.es/schema#surface> "13.42 Km2" .
